feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission clearly implements a working financial application: it generates multi-scenario investment outputs, performs compound-interest calculations, and writes structured results to Google Sheets (demoed and supported by implemented code). The Discover and Implement stages provide concrete evidence of functionality and calculation, meeting the PASS standard.
- Integrate AI: The student clearly integrated AI components (an agent that produces bear/base/bull scenarios, structured JSON output parsing, automated sheet ingestion, and a compound-interest calculator) and documented implementation details and iteration. Use of Gemini to generate parser code and explicit pipeline descriptions show substantive, functional AI integration beyond superficial use.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So here we're going to go into the chat and we're going to do a scenario where I invest $50,000 into Target."
"On the right here, you'll see my JavaScript code for my structured output parser."
"I added the calculator into my model just so the compound interest could be done more adequately."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover — identified the need for scenario-based financial modeling and built a "financial scenario generator."  
Implement — demonstrated a live scenario (invest $50,000 into Target), JavaScript structured output parser, Google Sheets integration, and a calculator for compound interest.  
Reflect — acknowledged tool construction choices and collaborative code generation, and framed the program as a simulation (ethical consideration).
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly implements a working financial application: it generates multi-scenario investment outputs, performs compound-interest calculations, and writes structured results to Google Sheets (demoed and supported by implemented code). The Discover and Implement stages provide concrete evidence of functionality and calculation, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "for my advanced AI finance tool, I built the financial scenario generator."
"I added the structured output parser and then I used the split out mechanism before it goes into my Google sheet and then we also have coding through JavaScript."
"I helped generate this code using Gemini just cuz I'm not too experienced, but uh we did it together and we implemented it into our NA8 model."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover — identified the need for scenario-based (nonlinear) outputs and designed the financial scenario generator.  
Implement — described concrete integrations: AI agent persona, structured output parser (JSON), JavaScript code, Google Sheets pipeline, and a calculator for compound interest.  
Reflect — acknowledged collaboration with Gemini to generate code and iterated the model for consistent outputs and guardrails.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly integrated AI components (an agent that produces bear/base/bull scenarios, structured JSON output parsing, automated sheet ingestion, and a compound-interest calculator) and documented implementation details and iteration. Use of Gemini to generate parser code and explicit pipeline descriptions show substantive, functional AI integration beyond superficial use.
